TopicTitle: BSC: Super-Heavy Lander - The next BSC will.....

Articles.Content:
T-Class Heavy Lander

T-Class Heavy Lander

I have included the T-Class Heavy Lander with launch stage to allow new players to put this lander into orbit of Kerbin.

T-Class Heavy Lander w/LS

[table=width: 900, class: outer_border, align: center]

[tr]

[td][/td]

[/tr]

[/table]

Design Goals:

The "T-Class Heavy Lander" has been primarily built to allow landing/return to orbit from Tylo when full of fuel.

The secondary goal for the rest of the planets/moons have been to allow easy IVA landings and huge margins of error for piloting when it comes to fuel and a moderate pod SAS speed all of which should improve piloting skill.

The third goal is to allow a minor slowdown in the atmosphere when landing to allow fuel to burn off improving the TWR(Thrust to weight ratio).

Planets/moons able to land/return to orbit from:

All Jool's moons

Eeelo

Dres

Duna, Ike

All Kerbins moons

Eve's moon Gilly

Moho

Specs: T-Class Heavy Lander

107.735 tons

6,878 DV with all engines fireing

103 parts

2 Kerbals

2 cupola command pods

2 drogue parachutes (able to decouple)

1 standard shielded docking port (able to decouple)

4 landing legs

Action groups:

1. All engines but nukes - toggle

2. Only nukes - toggle

3. Solar Panels - toggle

4. Ladders - toggle

Gear. Landing legs - toggle

Lights. Landing lights - toggle

Abort. All engines and parachutes - on

Flight tips:

Tylo:

If going to land/return from Tylo make sure all fuel and stages are attached.

Ditching the parachutes is advised.

Slowing down horizontal velocity at PE of 10,000-15,000m is recommended.

Make sure you stay above 4,600m until your slow enough around 400-500m/s

Watching fuel is necessary.

Watching altimeter is necessary.

To return to orbit the two tanks with the LV-909 engines must be near full.

Everything else:

Stages are set up to work well in vacuum if entering atmosphere fuel flow from the small fuel tanks will drain faster with all engines on.

file description available in VAB.

Have fun try landing from the bottom cupola pod while in cockpit(IVA view)

I know this is way off topic but there is another challenge that deserves some some attention. It is not my challenge and I don't know the guy but WOW! What he did is amazing, and I think he is not getting the attention he deserves for it. I know this thread gets a lot of views, heck I am entered in this challenge too, so I thought I would share a link here.

I hope you don't mind Xeldrak. I was just too good for it to go unnoticed.

T-Class Heavy Lander

the bottom cupola's genius!
T class heavy lander for the win

Straight from the lab of Genius Evil, his most Evil Geniusness, comes a revolutionary new luxury lander.

Behold!

MENDELEV 3!

Most contemporary lander designs are "Efficient" "Low part count" or "Minimalist". Space pickup trucks, if you will

The discerning customer wants something... Different. That's where MENDELEV 3 comes in. A work of genius, evil genius that is, the MENDELEV 3 is a

"Space luxury coupe", the Mercedes-Benz, the BMW, the Lexus of the lander world. MENDELEV 3 has features.

HIGH DELTA-V: The MENDELEV 3 is theoretically capable of landing on Duna and returning to orbit. Munar landings can be done with no risk of fuel shortages.

HANDS FREE PILOTING: An automated control module means you can sit back in your leather-upholstered acceleration couch inside the habitation module and enjoy the landing.

LANDING LEGS: The MENDELEV 3's NO-SHOK landing legs can hit the ground at speeds in excess of 15m/s without damage. And they look great. (DISCLAIMER: NOT MY INVENTION)

STYLING: The MENDELEV 3 features futuristic 3x symmetry. Three protective panels are also jettisoned after landing. Still trying to justify that one.

U-LOAD ATTACHMENT SYSTEM: Three jr. docking ports are featured for attaching the payload of your choice. (payloads not included)

TWO-STAGE DESIGN: Shows that you can afford to leave parts behind.

Don't wait! Get yours today!

Had the opportunity to have a brief look at all the entries to date and knocked together a table with some vital statistics:


Entry                                            Mass   Parts  Vacuum DV  Crew Cap
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
DaveofDefeat - ultra heavy colony class lander  243.75   260    3,998       123
Supernovy - Crew Transport Lander                11.81    41    1,421         6
mcirish3 - Sagiitta V2                          169.23   206    5,126         4
Blaster - ROFL                                   17.50    30    2,338         3
SirJodelstein - Great Heavy Lander               43.29   116    3,904         3
MiniMatt - Gonzalez Light Heavyweight            32.80    57    3,600         6
frizzank - super-heavy-lander                    29.53    58    2,998         7
Sirine - UFO 1                                   26.66   154    1,736*        3
Teirusu - IPL One                                37.63    81    5,107         3
Haze-Zero - Pilgrim Mk1                          15.19    39    3,138         4
Xeldrak - CRUEL                                  42.52   101    4,111         3
Pulsar - Theseus HAU                             35.40    71    3,185         6
GusTurbo - The Heavy                             64.64   100    3,902         5
pedorsf - SHLNA                                  69.48    97    3,838         4
Rhomphaia - Heavy Multi-Role Lander              34.49    80    3,315         4
Hejnfelt - 7X lander                             75.10   109    5,052         7
Accelerando - Mulefly One                        60.50   114    4,301         6
Smoke - Large Planet Explorer                    60.21    77    5,950        12
briansun1 - XV-6V                                69.62   171    3,440*        6
mpink - Pinks Heavy Lander MK4                   24.47    52    1,515         3
I_Killed_Jeb - Aeneas II                         58.62   151    3,054*        3
Actzoltan - T-Class Heavy Lander                107.74   101    6,878*        2
Genius Evil - Mendelev 3                         36.47   170    4,648         4
AmpsterMan - Duna Lander X                       50.58    56    3,832         3

(entries with a delta-v value marked * have multiple engine types toggle-able within the same stage and hence DV values may change drastically in use)

Note that these are by no means the only or most important values to consider. One may wish to consider aesthetics, ease of fixing to launch vehicles, RCS placement, utility value, ease of build replication, and not least the Challenge guidelines linked by Xeldrak. There are numerous factors involved; one may value the aesthetics in the UFO, the utility in the Mulefly One, the beautiful insanity in the Ultra Heavy Colony Class, the destination variety available with the T-Class Heavy (or, ahem, the gentlemanly charm and elegant simplicity of the Gonzalez Light Heavyweight).

Treat the above table merely as a jumping off point to further investigation.

Edited October 15, 2013 by MiniMatt
My UFO got toggle-able engines. Key 1, Key 2, and Key 10 for Ladder, and Key Abort for self-destruction.

and Key Abort for self-destruction.

Great! Nowadays when a mission goes awry the crew swallows poison, but we need a way to remotely destroy all evidence as well.

My UFO got toggle-able engines. Key 1, Key 2, and Key 10 for Ladder, and Key Abort for self-destruction.

Indeed. I didn't add an asterisk to yours to denote substantially variable DV for a couple of reasons:

  1. Difference in delta-v between running the 390 vacuum ISP clipped aerospike engine and the four 350 ISP rockomax engines is likely to be fairly slim, unlike the nuke v. LV909 differences seen in some other designs.
  2. Individual engines have specified fuel tanks - eg. the aerospike can't take from the radial tanks (while the radials can take from the central tank this will only ever result in lower than listed DV due to rockomaxes lower ISP at all atmospheres). Without manually transferring fuel between tanks (something not really possible with the level of clipping) the aerospike has a fixed ~622 dv available to it. This is different to some of the designs marked where the same fuel can be burnt at either 200 ISP, 390 ISP or 800 ISP which will have very significant effects on delta-v.

Edited October 14, 2013 by MiniMatt
